definitions.definition: discharge a gun or other weapon in order to explosively propel (a bullet or projectile).
examples: he fired a shot at the retreating prisoners
synonyms: let fly with More"howitzers firing shells"shoot

definitions.definition: direct (questions or statements, especially unwelcome ones) toward someone in rapid succession.
examples: they fired questions at me for what seemed like ages

definitions.definition: send a message aggressively, especially as one of a series.
examples: he fired off a letter informing her that he regarded the matter with the utmost seriousness
having to fire men who've been with me for years

definitions.definition: supply (a furnace, engine, boiler, or power station) with fuel.
(of an internal combustion engine, or a cylinder in one) undergo ignition of its fuel when started.
examples: the engine fired and she pushed her foot down on the accelerator

definitions.definition: stimulate or excite (the imagination or an emotion).

examples: in the locker room they were really fired up
If I were to hear anyone disparage you, I would fire up in a flash

definitions.definition: bake or dry (pottery, bricks, etc.) in a kiln.

examples: with a flick of his wrist he fired up the chainsaw
